en.keep_running:
Now you are inside the animal's body 
 Next.. Keep running!
en.opening_0: Hello, you must be the new energy spirit!
en.opening_1: My name is Elvia, and I am a Food Fairy.
en.opening_2: Welcome to earth, and I'll be your guide!
en.opening_3: Now, I'll guide you how to play this game.
en.goat_eat_grass_0: Look! The goat is eating the grass!
en.goat_eat_grass_1: Don't worry. As the goat eats the grass, the energy inside the grass is transferred to the goat.
en.goat_eat_grass_2: So now it's your job to support the goat!
en.goat_eat_grass_3: As we can see, the energy moves from the producer to the primary consumer - in this case, the goat.
en.goat_eat_grass_4: So let's go and enjoy the goat life!
en.wolf_eat_goat_0: Yikes! You've been hunted by the wolf!
en.wolf_eat_goat_1: But that's how life goes. As the primary consumer, you have been eaten by the secondary consumer.
en.wolf_eat_goat_2: As a carnivore, the wolf primarily eats meat. So they eat the goat to gain energy!.
en.wolf_eat_goat_3: Now let's go and run like a wolf!
en.lion_eat_wolf_1: This is strange. Usually a lion doesn't hunt wolves!
en.lion_eat_wolf_2: Maybe it got separated and desperately hungry?
en.lion_eat_wolf_3: But with this, the secondary consumer has been eaten by the tertiary consumer!
en.lion_eat_wolf_4: Tertiary consumers eat secondary consumers in food chain. Therefore, they are carnivores too!
en.lion_eat_wolf_5: The energy has gone a long way from the sun, grass, goat, wolf, and to this lion.
en.lion_eat_wolf_6: Now, let's go and roar like a Lion!
en.lion_dead_0: It looks like your lion has reached its final age.
en.lion_dead_1: As all living creatures, a lion will someday die.
en.lion_dead_3: The dead body is being decomposed by decomposers.
en.lion_dead_4: The decomposers help by breaking down large organic molecules into forms that other organisms can use.
en.lion_dead_5: This makes energy available for plants to grow!
en.lion_dead_6: So in the end, it's all an infinite cycle.
en.lion_dead_7: If one of the chains is disturbed, it would affect the others too.
en.lion_dead_8: Now let's see the forest population!
en.ending_ga_banyak_nyelametin_0: You didn't rescue much goats nor wolves, so the lion population diminishes.
en.ending_ga_banyak_nyelametin_1: The carnivores needs other animals as their source of energy,
en.ending_ga_banyak_nyelametin_2: so their survivability depends on other's population.
en.ending_ga_banyak_nyelametin_3: One population's condition will affect the others in the food web.
en.ending_ga_banyak_nyelametin_4: Maybe you can try rescuing more animals next time!
en.ending_sheep_banyak_wolf_dikit_0: You rescued quite a lot goats, that allowed the carnivores to survive!
en.ending_sheep_banyak_wolf_dikit_1: The carnivores needs other animals as their source of energy,
en.ending_sheep_banyak_wolf_dikit_2: so their survivability depends on other's population.
en.ending_sheep_banyak_wolf_dikit_3: One population's condition will affect the others in the food web.
en.ending_sheep_banyak_wolf_dikit_4: Make sure to keep rescuing lots of animal!
en.ending_sheep_dikit_wolf_banyak_0: You didn't rescue many sheeps but you rescued a lot of wolves.
en.ending_sheep_dikit_wolf_banyak_1: The wolves need to eat goat in this forest as their source of energy,
en.ending_sheep_dikit_wolf_banyak_2: so now they can't live and their number diminishes!
en.ending_sheep_dikit_wolf_banyak_3: Since there are few wolves and goat, the lion does not have a source of food, either.
en.ending_sheep_dikit_wolf_banyak_4: One population's condition will affect the others in the food web.
en.ending_sheep_dikit_wolf_banyak_5: Maybe you can try rescuing more animals next time!
en.ending_sheep_wolf_banyak_0: You rescued a lot of goats and wolves</color>, so the lion population stay large.
en.ending_sheep_wolf_banyak_1: The carnivores needs other animals as their source of energy,
en.ending_sheep_wolf_banyak_2: so their survivability depends on other's population.
en.ending_sheep_wolf_banyak_3: One population's condition will affect the others in the food web.
en.ending_sheep_wolf_banyak_4: Good job on rescuing those animals!
en.opening2_0: Here, you'll help by providing energy to living creatures.
en.opening2_1: First of all, let's start growing this seed!
en.opening2_2: Collect all the sunshine you need so that the grass can grow!
en.endinfo-0_1: Here's some other variations of food chain!
en.endinfo-0_2: And as usual, the mighty eagle will be decomposed and returned to the soil in the end.
en.endinfo-1_1: Here's some other variations of food chain!
en.endinfo-1_2: Can you guess what is the continuation of this food webs?
en.EndInfo-2_1: Here's some other variations of food chain!
en.EndInfo-2_2: The sea is also an interesting place to observe food webs environment.
en.EndInfo-3_2: Primary consumers are usually herbivore, since they only feed on the producers.
en.EndInfo-3_3: And sometimes tertiary consumers can be secondary too, since it depends on the availability on the other population.
en.NatQuest-1_2: Plants are able to perform photosynthesis, which produces their own energy from the sun. Hence, the name, Producer!
en.NatQuest-2_2: Primary consumers are the living organisms that eats the producers (plants). So they are the herbivores!
en.NatQuest-3_2: As organism moves and lives, the energy is converted into heat. That's why energy decreases while transferring from one organism to another!
en.NatQuest-4_2: In the food web, the job of bacteria, fungi, and earthworms is to decompose dead animal/plants. That's why they are called Decomposers!
en.NatQuest-5_2: Plants need sunlight, carbon dioxide and water to perform photosynthesis.
en.NatQuest-6_2: Without plants, there would be nothing in this world which could produce their own food. This means that without the plants, someday our source of food will run out!
